starvationevasion.common.card

Class InternationalFoodReliefProgramPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.common.card.PolicyCard
      • starvationevasion.common.card.PolicyInternationalFoodRelief
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, JSON, Sendable

    public class InternationalFoodReliefProgramPolicy
extends PolicyCard
    Title: "International Food Relief Program"

    Game Text: "Each participating region spends X million dollars to purchase their own regions commodity food for relief of world hunger."

    Draft Affects: When drafting this policy, player selects an amount X to be paid by EACH player who approves the policy.

    Votes Required: 1 through all
    Eligible Regions: All U.S.

    Model Effects: Commodity food is distributed to relief world hunger in the most efficient manor discovered by the sim where efficiency calculation is based on the type of commodity available in each participating region, each country's nutritional need and each country's import penalty function. Note: depending on yields, different regions may contribute different mixes of commodities.

    10% bonus to effectiveness of total dollars spent per participating region.

    Food purchased for relief inflates the global sell foodPrice of the food type by a direct reduction of supply without effect on demand (since those to whom the relief is delivered are presumed to lack the resources to have been part of the demand).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • votesRequired

        public int votesRequired()
        In the abstract Policy class, this method returns the default behavior of a policy card (votesRequired() = 0). If a class extending Policy is not automatic, then it must override this method.
        Overrides:
        votesRequired in class PolicyCard
        Returns:
        0 if the policy is automatic. Otherwise, returns the number of votes required for the policy to be enacted.
        Note: This will always return a number that is no smaller than the number of regions returned by getRegionsEligibleToVote().

      • voteWaitForAll

        public boolean voteWaitForAll()
        In the abstract Policy class, this method returns the default behavior of a policy card (voteWaitForAll() = false). If a class extending Policy is not automatic and requires waiting, then it must override this method.
        Overrides:
        voteWaitForAll in class PolicyCard
        Returns:
        true if voting should continue until all eligible players have voted on this policy. Return false if voting should stop as soon as the required number of votes have been reached.
